p.b: Creating a Sales Order for Package Items: User Story 1

ul.li: To create a sales order for package items.

After you have created a new sales order and clicked the Shopping Cart button, add the Annual Conference Sponsorship to your cart. (You may need to filter the results of your shopping cart by Item Class, in this case it will be Corporate Sponsorships.)
Next, click Available Package Items to view the package items that are available for purchase along with the Annual Conference Sponsorship.
Click the green Add Item button. Your total will update to include both items.

body.p: Info/Note: You will get an error message if you don't have the minimum number of package items required, or if you go over the maximum number of package items allowed.

ul.li: Once you have made a payment, you will be directed to the Sales Order record, where you will see the Sales Order Lines for the items you purchased, including the package item.
The Sales Order will be closed and posted.
Transactions and Transactions Lines will be created.
A Receipt record will be created.
An ePayment record will be created.

p.b: Creating a Sales Order for Package Items: User Story 2

ul.li: After you have created a new sales order and clicked the Shopping Cart button, add the Advertising Banner to your cart. (You may need to filter the results of your shopping cart by Item Class, in this case it will be Advertising.)
Next, click Available Package Items to view the package items that are available to choose along with the purchase of the Advertising Banner.
Select the items you wish to include in your purchase, and then click the Submit button. The total will update to include all the items you have selected.
Once you have made a payment, you will be directed to the Sales Order record, where you will see the Sales Order Lines for the items you purchased, including the package items.
The Sales Order will be closed and posted.
Transactions and Transactions Lines will be created.
A Receipt record will be created.
An ePayment record will be created, if you paid with an ePayment method. (In this case, we paid with a offline payment of a check.)
